thread.title: Charles Tan case timeline: When was his father killed?
thread.title_full: Charles Tan case timeline: When was his father killed?

author: Staff reports
title: Charles Tan case timeline: When was his father killed?
text:
Key dates and events in the Charles Tan murder case: Jan. 28
Charles Tan's mother, Qing "Jean" Tan, calls 911 and desperately tells a dispatcher her husband, Liang "Jim" Tan, had choked her and was trying to kill her. Liang Tan gets on the phone and downplays the incident, calling his wife "childish." A deputy arrived at the house at 10:40 p.m. but Qing Tan declined to have her husband arrested.
County records show that this was one of 18 calls to the home from 2003 to before the Feb. 9 arrest.
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Complete coverage: Charles Tan murder trial
Feb. 5
12:45 p.m.: Jacob Grossman, a 20-year-old graduate of Pittsford Mendon, receives a call from Tan and the two agreed to meet that night.
4 p.m.: Whitney Knickerbocker, Charles Tan's friend, purchases a shotgun that was suspected to be used in the shooting from a Walmart in Cortland.
Time unknown: Anna Valentine, a close friend and former high school classmate of Charles Tan, said she and her boyfriend went to dinner with Charles the night of Feb. 5.
8:40 p.m.: A Dynamax employee testified that she received her last email from Liang Tan. She never heard from him the next day, which was unusual, she said.
10 p.m. (approx): Grossman and Tan meet up and Tan says he's planning to leave the country. His behavior was out of character, Grossman testified, so he decided to call 911 and he and his mother, Julie, drove to the Tan house.
11:35 p.m.: Deputy William Connell goes to the Tan home based on Grossman's call to 911 and speaks with Charles Tan for five to 10 minutes. His demeanor was calm, Connell testified.
Feb. 6
According to Tan's friend, Anna Valentine, she received a text from him Feb. 6 stating, "I love you and will talk to you soon." She found the text unusual and tried unsuccessfully to reach him.
According to Assistant District Attorney William Gargan, there is evidence that Tan traveled to Canada on Feb. 6 and returned on Feb. 9.
Feb. 9
5:13 p.m.: Charles Tan sends an email to his fraternity brothers that hinted at trouble ahead and that some of them could soon get "visits from the authorities." The subject of the email was: "Showtime."
Time unknown: A hysterical Qing "Jean" Tan calls 911 to report that her son had shot her husband. She says her son was trying to protect her because her husband "was trying to torture me."
6:10 p.m.: Deputy Christopher Cooper arrives on the scene and testified that Charles Tan told him that his father was in the house, he was dead and "he had to do it because he was going to kill his mother." Tan is arrested.
Feb. 10
Tan is arraigned on second-degree murder charges in Pittsford Town Court.
"The Charlie Tan Support Fund" is created online and subsequently raises close to $50,000 to help pay for his defense.
Feb. 13
Tan indicted by a grand jury. At a brief appearance at Pittsford Town Court, which became unnecessary due to the indictment, more than 100 of Tan's supporters showed up.
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Outpouring of support for teen accused in slaying
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Andreatta: 'Honor thy father' haunts Charles Tan case
Feb. 27
Tan's indictment is released publicly. It's revealed that the shooting could have happened anytime between Feb. 5 and Feb. 9.
March 5
In County Court, Tan pleads not guilty to the murder charge and was released on $50,000 bail.
Charles Tan's defense attorney, James Nobles, prosecutor William Gargan, and Tan's former soccer coach, Kevin McPherson, react after his arraignment. Video by Lauren Petracca
June 17
At a hearing, the defense withdraws its request to have Tan's admission statement to deputies at the scene suppressed.
July 1
At another hearing, Judge James Piampiano asks that the autopsy for Liang Tan be expedited and completed by early August to give both sides ample time to prepare for trial.
Sept. 14
Jury selection begins.
Sept. 22
Lawyers present their opening statements.
Sept. 28
Jury visits the Tan home on Coach Side Lane in Pittsford after Piampiano on Sept. 25 approved the prosecution's request, saying the trip would be useful. Later in the day, after a handful of witnesses, the defense rested.
Sept. 29
Closing arguments delivered and deliberations begin.
Buy Photo William Gargan spoke to Charles Tan directly many times during his opening. He said directly to Charles, "This is what your lawyer said about your mother, she is a liar." At that point Judge James Piampiano stopped the trial and ordered the jury out of the courtroom. (Photo: MAX SCHULTE/@maxrocphoto/STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER)
